required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of Treatment Safety and Quality of Life in Patients Receiving Etanercept Biosimilar for Autoimmune Arthritis
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of Treatment Safety and Quality of Life in Patients Receiving Etanercept Biosimilar for Autoimmune Arthritis (ASQA): a Multicenter Post-marketing Surveillance Study

brief_summary.textblock: In this open-label, multi-center, observational, post-marketing surveillance study, patients with ankylosing spondylitis, psoriatic arthritis, or rheumatoid arthritis received biosimilar etanercept 25 mg twice weekly or 50 mg once weekly in real-world settings. Safety and effectiveness of biosimilar etanercept were evaluated in study participants for a duration of up to 12 months.

detailed_description.textblock: In this open-label, multi-center, observational, post-marketing surveillance study, patients with ankylosing spondylitis, psoriatic arthritis, or rheumatoid arthritis received biosimilar etanercept 25 mg twice weekly or 50 mg once weekly in real-world settings. Safety and effectiveness of biosimilar etanercept were evaluated in study participants for a duration of up to 12 months. Patient information was recorded in four notebooks, and each notebook had three sections, one section for each month. The first section of notebook I contained demographic information, pregnancy and lactation status in female patients, cigarette smoking and alcohol consumption, and past medical history. All safety and effectiveness outcomes were recorded at the appropriate sections of the notebooks.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the study period (up to 12 months for each patient)
primary_outcome.description: All adverse events, including serious adverse events, are reported using system organ classes and preferred terms of the medical dictionary for regulatory activities (MedDRA Desktop Browser 4.0 Beta).

secondary_outcome.description: Health assessment questionnaire (HAQ) is a functional test used in patients with a wide variety of rheumatic diseases, including rheumatoid arthritis, ankylosing spondylitis, and psoriatic arthritis. HAQ score ranges from 0 to 3, with higher scores indicating more severe functional disability.
Pain assessment is performed on a scale of 0 to 10, with higher scores indicating greater pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient global assessments of disease activity (PGA)
secondary_outcome.description: Patient global assessment of disease activity (PGA) is a very common patient reported outcome measure used in rheumatic disorders. PGA assessment is performed on a scale of 0 to 10, with higher scores indicating higher disease activity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Physician global assessment of disease activity (PhGA)
secondary_outcome.description: Physician global assessment of disease activity (PhGA) is used to assess disease severity by physicians. PhGA assessment is performed on a scale of 0 to 10, with higher scores indicating higher disease activity.

arm_group.description: Patients with autoimmune arthritis, including rheumatoid arthritis, ankylosing spondylitis, and psoriatic arthritis, receiving biosimilar etanercept in real-world settings

intervention.description: Patients received biosimilar etanercept 25 mg twice weekly or 50 mg once weekly.

study_pop.textblock: Adult patients with rheumatoid arthritis, ankylosing spondylitis, or psoriatic arthritis receiving biosimilar etanercept (either 25 mg or 50 mg) for their medical condition were eligible for this study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults with the diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis, ankylosing spondylitis, or psoriatic arthritis receiving biosimilar etanercept (either 25 mg or 50 mg) for their medical condition.
Exclusion Criteria:
- No strict exclusion criteria were applied.

overall_official.affiliation: Rheumatology Research Center, Tehran University of Medical Sciences

facility.name: Connective Diseases Research Center, Tabriz University of Medical Sciences
Rheumatology Research Center, Tehran University of Medical Sciences

patient_data.ipd_description: All collected deidentified individual participant data (IPD) will be shared.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Data would be shared upon reasonable request from the Study Principal Investigator, without any specific criteria: Ahmadreza Jamshidi Rheumatology Research Center, Tehran University of Medical Sciences, Tehran, Iran Email: dr.ahmadreza.jamshidi@gmail.com Tel: +982188220065
